_**User (2025-12-07 18:42-0500)**_

clicking primitives overview then colors leaves the active state on both menu items

---

_**Agent (model claude-4.5-opus-high-thinking, mode Agent)**_

<think><details><summary>Thought Process</summary>
The user is seeing that both "Overview" and "Colors" show as active when clicking on Colors. This is because the `isActive` function checks if the pathname starts with the href. Since `/tokens/primitives/colors` starts with `/tokens/primitives`, both items are showing as active.

I need to modify the `isActive` logic to handle this case properly. The Overview link should only be active when the path is exactly `/tokens/primitives`, not when it's a sub-path like `/tokens/primitives/colors`.

Let me look at the current isActive function:

```javascript
const isActive = (href: string) => {
  if (href === '/') return pathname === '/';
  return pathname === href || pathname.startsWith(href + '/');
};
```

The issue is that for `/tokens/primitives`, the function returns true if pathname starts with `/tokens/primitives/`, which includes `/tokens/primitives/colors`.

I need to update this logic. One approach is to check for exact matches for items that have siblings at deeper paths. But a simpler approach is to just use exact matching for all items, or to be smarter about when to use startsWith.

Actually, looking at the navigation structure, the `startsWith` logic was probably intended for nested children. But now that we've flattened the structure, we should probably just use exact matching for most items.

Let me think about this more carefully:
- `/` should only match exactly `/`
- `/tokens/primitives` should only match exactly `/tokens/primitives`
- `/tokens/primitives/colors` should only match exactly `/tokens/primitives/colors`
- etc.

But we might still want `startsWith` behavior for sections that have deep nesting. Let me check if there are any such cases...

Looking at the current nav structure, most items are flat. The only case where we might want startsWith is if there are pages like `/components/buttons/variants` that should still highlight the "Buttons" nav item.

For now, I think the safest fix is to use exact matching by default, since the user has flattened the primitives structure. I could also make the isActive function smarter by checking if there's another nav item that's a more specific match.


I'll explore a straightforward solution that ensures precise navigation highlighting. The exact matching approach seems most reliable for the current navigation structure. I'll implement a simple check that compares the current pathname directly with the href, avoiding any unintended matches from partial path overlaps.

The key consideration is handling different navigation scenarios, particularly parent and child page relationships. I want to create a method that accurately identifies active navigation items while maintaining flexibility for nested routes.

My strategy involves first checking for an exact match, then considering special cases like the root path. This approach provides a clean, predictable way to determine which navigation item should be visually highlighted based on the current page location.

The implementation focuses on precise matching, avoiding overly complex logic that might introduce unexpected behavior. By prioritizing exact matches and handling root path scenarios, I can create a robust navigation highlighting mechanism.</details></think>

---

The issue is that the `isActive` function uses `startsWith`, so when you're on `/tokens/primitives/colors`, it matches both that path AND `/tokens/primitives` (since the colors path starts with the overview path).

Let me fix the `isActive` logic to use exact matching:

=============================================================================\n\nfunction CopyButton({ value, size = 'md' }: { value: string; size?: 'sm' | 'md' }) {\n  const [copied, setCopied] = x: rect.left + rect.width / 2, y: rect.top - 8 });\n      }\n      setCopied(true);\n      setTimeout(() =&gt; {\n        setCopied(false);\n        setTooltipPos(null);\n      }, 1500);\n    } catch (err) {\n      console.error('Failed to copy:', err);\n    }\n  };\n\n  const iconSize = size === 'sm' ? 12 : 14;\n  const buttonSize = size === 'sm' ? 20 : 24;\n\n  return (\n    &lt;&gt;\n 'var(--color-muted)',\n          cursor: 'pointer',\n          transition: 'all var(--duration-100) var(--ease-out)',\n          flexShrink: 0,\n        }}\n        onMouseEnter={(e) =&gt; {\n          e.currentTarget.style.borderColor = 'var(--color-brand)';\n          e.currentTarget.style.color = 'var(--color-brand)';\n        }}\n        onMouseLeave={(e) =&gt; {\n          e.currentTarget.style.borderColor = 'var(--color-card-border)';\n          e.currentTarget.style.color = 'var(--color-muted)';\n        }}\n      &gt;\n        &lt;Copy size={iconSize} /&gt;\n      &lt;/button&gt;\n      {copied &amp;&amp; tooltipPos &amp;&amp; typeof document !== 'undefined' &amp;&amp; ReactDOM.createPortal(\n        &lt;div\n          style={{\n            position: 'fixed',\n            left: tooltipPos.x,\n            top: tooltipPos.y,\n            transform: 'translate(-50%, -100%)',\n            padding: '6px 10px',\n            backgroundColor: '#1e293b',\n '0 4px 12px rgba(0,0,0,0.15)',\n            pointerEvents: 'none',\n            animation: 'tooltipFadeIn 0.15s ease-out',\n          }}\n        &gt;\n          Copied!\n        &lt;/div&gt;,\n        document.body\n      )}\n    &lt;/&gt;\n  );\n}\n\nfunction isLightColor(hex: string): boolean {\n  const r = parseInt(hex.slice(1, 3), 16);\n  const g = parseInt(hex.slice(3, 5), 16);\n  const b = parseInt(hex.slice(5, 7), 16);\n  const luminance = (0.299 * r + 0.587 * g + 0.114 * b) / 255;\n  return luminance &gt; 0.5;\n}\n\n/**\n * Token Chain - shows: Value → Primitive → Semantic\n * Using consistent chip style with icon and border\n */\nfunction TokenChainDisplay({ primitiveRef, resolvedHex }: { primitiveRef: string; resolvedHex: string }) {\n  return (\n    &lt;div style={{ display: 'flex', alignItems: 'center', gap: 'var(--spacing-1-5)', flexWrap: 'wrap' }}&gt;\n      {/* Raw Value */}\n      &lt;div\n        style={{\n          display: 'flex',\n          alignItems: 'center',\n          gap: 'var(--spacing-1)',\n          padding: 'var(--spacing-1) var(--spacing-2)',\n          backgroundColor: 'var(--color-background)',\n          border: '1px solid var(--color-border)',\n          borderRadius: 'var(--radius-md)',\n        }}\n      &gt;\n        &lt;span style={{ fontSize: 'var(--font-size-caption)', fontFamily: 'ui-monospace, monospace', color: 'var(--color-foreground)' }}&gt;\n          {resolvedHex}\n        &lt;/span&gt;\n      &lt;/div&gt;\n\n      &lt;ArrowRight size={10} style={{ color: 'var(--color-muted)' }} /&gt;\n\n      {/* Primitive */}\n      &lt;div\n        style={{\n          display: 'flex',\n          alignItems: 'center',\n          gap: 'var(--spacing-1)',\n          padding: 'var(--spacing-1) {primitiveRef}\n        &lt;/span&gt;\n      &lt;/div&gt;\n\n      &lt;ArrowRight size={10} style={{ color: 'var(--color-muted)' }} /&gt;\n\n      {/* Semantic */}\n      &lt;div\n        style={{\n          display: 'flex',\n          alignItems: 'center',\n          gap: 'var(--spacing-1)',\n          padding: 'var(--spacing-1) var(--spacing-2)',\n          backgroundColor: '#10b98110',\n token }: { token: SemanticColorToken }) {\n  const [copied, setCopied] = useState(false);\n\n  const handleCopy = async () =&gt; {\n    try {\n      await navigator.clipboard.writeText(&#96;var(${token.cssVariable})&#96;);\n      setCopied(true);\n      setTimeout(() =&gt; setCopied(false), 2000);\n    } catch (err) {\n      console.error('Failed to copy:', err);\n    }\n  };\n\n  return (\n    &lt;div\n      className=\"color-swatch-token\"\n      style={{\n        backgroundColor: 'var(--color-card)',\n        border: '1px solid '1px solid var(--color-card-border)' : 'none',\n        }}\n      &gt;\n        &lt;span\n          style={{\n            fontSize: 'var(--font-size-caption)',\n            fontFamily: 'ui-monospace, monospace',\n            color: isLightColor(token.resolvedHex) ?
